title: Paul Cezanne The Bathers Unmatted Print
description:
Print developed from Paul Cezanne’s The Bathers, 1899-1904, from The Art Institute of Chicago’s collection.

Through his studies of groups of bathers outdoors, Paul Cézanne reconceived a classical subject in a modern, pictorial idiom. It is an independent, exploratory work painted with a more spritely touch. For all its compositional complexity, it retains the lightness of a watercolor, with thin parallel strokes and dashes and areas of white-primed canvas showing through the paint.

  • Print Reproduction
  • Image size:  13.375 x 11 in.
  • Full poster size: 16 x 12 in.
  • Material: Premium Cardstock
